    • decrypt

      Use only to store encrypted data. Do NOT use for authentication. Considered a weak encryption.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
      NoSuchPaddingException
      InvalidKeyException
      IllegalBlockSizeException
      BadPaddingException

    • encrypt

      public static byte[] encrypt(byte[] input) throws Exception
      Encrypts the given byte array using AES/GCM/NoPadding.

      This method encrypts the provided `input` byte array using AES encryption in GCM mode with no padding. It generates a random 12-byte initialization vector (IV) and uses a 128-bit GCM parameter specification. The encrypted bytes are then combined with the IV and returned as a single byte array.

      Parameters:
      input - The byte array to encrypt.
      Returns:
      The encrypted byte array, which includes the IV prepended to the ciphertext.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the secret key is not initialized, or if there is an error during encryption. Specifically: - If the SECRET_KEY_SPEC is null, indicating the secret key has not been initialized. - If the "AES/GCM/NoPadding" cipher is not available. - If there is an issue with the encryption process itself, such as invalid key or data.

    • decrypt

      public static byte[] decrypt(byte[] cipherBytes) throws Exception
      Decrypts the given byte array using AES/GCM/NoPadding.

      This method decrypts the provided `cipherBytes` byte array, which is assumed to be in the format produced by the `encrypt` method. It extracts the 12-byte initialization vector (IV) from the beginning of the array, and then decrypts the remaining bytes using AES in GCM mode with no padding.

      Parameters:
      cipherBytes - The encrypted byte array, including the prepended IV.
      Returns:
      The decrypted byte array.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the secret key is not initialized, or if there is an error during decryption. Specifically: - If the SECRET_KEY_SPEC is null, indicating the secret key has not been initialized. - If the "AES/GCM/NoPadding" cipher is not available. - If the input byte array is not in the expected format (e.g., IV is missing). - If there is an issue with the decryption process itself, such as an authentication failure (indicating data corruption).

    • encrypt

      public static String encrypt(String plainText) throws Exception
      Encrypts a plain text string.
      Parameters:
      plainText - The plain text string to encrypt.
      Returns:
      The encrypted string, prefixed with an encryption marker and encoded in Base64.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the secret key is not initialized, or if there is an error during encryption.

    • decrypt

      public static String decrypt(String encryptedText) throws Exception
      Decrypts an encrypted string.
      Parameters:
      encryptedText - The encrypted string to decrypt.
      Returns:
      The decrypted string, or the original string if it was not encrypted.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the secret key is not initialized, or if there is an error during decryption.

    • isEncrypted

      public static boolean isEncrypted(String input)
      Checks if a provided string is encrypted.

      This method determines if the input string starts with the encryption prefix, indicating that it has been encrypted. NULL and empty strings are returned as encrypted = true

      Parameters:
      input - The string to check for encryption.
      Returns:
      True if the string is encrypted (starts with the encryption prefix), False otherwise.

    • generateSecretKey

      public static String generateSecretKey() throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Generates a new secret key for encryption/decryption.

      This method uses the AES algorithm to generate a 256-bit secret key. The generated key is then Base64 encoded for storage and retrieval.

      Returns:
      The Base64 encoded string representation of the generated secret key.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the AES algorithm is not available.

    • prepareSecretKeySpec

      public static void prepareSecretKeySpec()
      Prepares the SecretKeySpec object used for encryption and decryption.

      This method retrieves the secret key from the OscarProperties, decodes it from Base64, and initializes the SECRET_KEY_SPEC with the decoded key. If the secret key is not found in the properties, an error is logged.

    • hash

      public static String hash(CharSequence password) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a secure hash of the given password using the PasswordHashHelper.
      Parameters:
      password - string
      Returns:
      hashed password
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the password is null or empty.
      See Also:
      • PasswordHashHelper.encodePassword(CharSequence)

    • verify

      public static boolean verify(CharSequence password, String hashedPassword) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validate a given password phrase against the stored hash password. This is a boolean validation. No password values are returned
      Parameters:
      password - plain password string
      hashedPassword - hashed password string usually stored in the database.
      Returns:
      True if the raw password matches the encoded password, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - failure while matching
      See Also:
      • PasswordHashHelper.matches(CharSequence, String)

    • isPasswordHashUpgradeNeeded

      public static boolean isPasswordHashUpgradeNeeded(String hashedPassword)
      Check if a given hashed password needs to be upgraded to a more secure algorithm.
      Parameters:
      hashedPassword - hashed password string usually stored in the database.
      Returns:
      true if upgrade is needed.
      See Also:
      • PasswordHashHelper.upgradeEncoding(String)
